title: Drawing, 1872
medium: Brush and  black wash, graphite on tan wove paper.
markings: Stamped, lower left corner, very faded: Museum for the Arts of Decoration, Cooper Union.
signed: Signed in black ink, lower right: TYMORAN. [TYM configured as the artist's mongram].
inscribed: Recto: Inscribed in pen and black ink and dated, from lower left to lower center: South Dome Yosemite, 1872; and again in graphite, lower margin: (16).
description: Vertical view of large boulders in foreground with tall pine tree in middle ground followed by  mountains leading to large mountain dome in background.

exhibitions.title: Frederic Church, Winslow Homer & Thomas Moran: Tourism and the American Landscape

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1872.
1872. Brush and  black wash, graphite on tan wove paper.. Gift of Thomas Moran. 1917-17-15.
